DragWordsInSentence.Question: What type of interaction can be seen in Jiemba's narrative which represents a global pattern? Drag and drop the terms to complete the sentence.
DragWordsInSentence.Sentence: The interaction between Jiemba's people and the British is best seen as a representation of contact between <<European>> colonizers and <<indigenous>> peoples.
DragWordsInSentence.distractors: French Native American sea Stone Age prisoner
DragWordsInSentence.policy: Score points for each wrong word which is corrected, deduct points for each correct word which was changed . Minimum score 0.

TextMultiSelect.Question: Select all that apply. The First Fleet arriving at Botany Bay can be seen as a symbol for:
TextMultiSelect.Answers: British oceanic colonial expansion. the beginning of the subjugation of indigenous Australians. the rise of the Dutch East India company. conflict between Britain, France, and Spain.
TextMultiSelect.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

PictureMultiSelect.Question: Jiemba expresses a wish to preserve his culture, and worries that the British may end his way of life. Which images show indigenous Australian cultural artifacts?
PictureMultiSelect.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

TextMultpleChoice.Question: Jiemba is distraught that the British do not respect sacred sites of the indigenous people. What common European belief of the time best explains why this occurred?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: Europeans believed that Christianity was superior to and more advanced than indigenous religions. Europeans valued democracy above traditional clan structures. Europeans built settlements and did not understand hunter-gatherer lifestyles. Europe underwent the Industrial Revolution.

TextMultiSelect.Question: Jiemba worries if he can pass on his culture. What examples are mentioned that show possible forms of cultural expression for indigenous Australians?
TextMultiSelect.Answers: Digeridoo music Hunting with traditional boomerang Dreamtime religious worldview Tall ships Settlements with permanent buildings
TextMultiSelect.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

TextMultiSelect.Question:
Consider this piece of text from Jiemba: "Biyanga is here no longer. He succumbed to the illness. Many more are infected and many have died. The white men brought strange diseases with him in his large boats. They have used fire sticks to kill us"
What does Jiemba describe that are common patterns during this time period? Select all that apply.
TextMultiSelect.Answers: Smaller groups of Europeans were able to use guns to defeat larger indigenous populations. New diseases caused the deaths of many indigenous people. The British used superior sailing ships to colonize the globe. Cultural diffusion took place across large empires.
TextMultiSelect.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

TextDragDrop.Question: Consider all of the these terms which relate to the narrative. Analyze them and determine if they best belong to the "British" or "Native Australian" category.
TextDragDrop.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

Box.name: British
Box.Items: tall ships convicts guns colonization European

TextMultpleChoice.Question: The colonization of Australia included an element that was unusual for the time period. What made this example different?
TextMultpleChoice.Answers: One purpose of the British was to establish a penal colony for prisoners. The British came into conflict with indigenous people. The colonizer sailed from far away. The native people fell victim to diseases.

TextMultiSelect.Question: The British overseas empires featured in the stories of Jiemba and Secret Agent 355. What reasons did European powers seek out far off colonies from 1750 to 1900? Select all that apply.
TextMultiSelect.Answers: To find raw materials to bring back to the home country. To stay powerful by establishing a large military presence around the world. To support a growing industrial economy in Europe. To establish friendly relations with indigenous people.
TextMultiSelect.policy: Score points when all answers are correct.

CorrectSentence.Question: Consider the interaction of worldviews between the British and Jiemba's people. Correct the errors in the following sentence.
CorrectSentence.Sentence: The British brought with them a religious worldview based on <<Hinduism/Christianity>>. They did not respect the native Australian beliefs called <<Digeridoo/Dreamtime>>.
CorrectSentence.policy: Score points for each wrong word which is corrected, deduct points for each correct word which was changed . Minimum score 0.
